Docs.summary: Performs certificate-related operations on an Azure Batch account.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CancelDeleteCertificate (string thumbprintAlgorithm, string thumbprint, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null);

.method public hidebysig instance void CancelDeleteCertificate(string thumbprintAlgorithm, string thumbprint, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

Docs.param: The algorithm used to derive the parameter. This must be sha1.
The thumbprint of the certificate that failed to delete.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Cancels a failed deletion of the specified certificate. This can be done only when the certificate is in the state, and restores the certificate to the state.
Docs.returns: A object that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: If you still wish to delete the certificate (instead of returning it to Active), you do not need to cancel the failed deletion. You must make sure that the certificate is not being used by any resources, and then you can try again to delete the certificate (see .
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Cancels a failed deletion of the specified certificate. This can be done only when the certificate is in the state, and restores the certificate to the state.
Docs.returns: A object that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: If you still wish to delete the certificate (instead of returning it to Active), you do not need to cancel the failed deletion. You must make sure that the certificate is not being used by any resources, and then you can try again to delete the certificate (see .
The cancel delete operation runs asynchronously.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> CustomBehaviors { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> CustomBehaviors

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of behaviors that modify or customize requests to the Batch service made via this .

remarks.para: These behaviors are inherited by child objects.
Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DeleteCertificate (string thumbprintAlgorithm, string thumbprint, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null);

.method public hidebysig instance void DeleteCertificate(string thumbprintAlgorithm, string thumbprint, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

Docs.param: The algorithm used to derive the parameter. This must be sha1.
The thumbprint of the certificate to delete.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Deletes the certificate from the Batch account.

remarks.para: The delete operation requests that the certificate be deleted. The request puts the certificate in the state. The Batch service will perform the actual certificate deletion without any further client action.
You cannot delete a certificate if a resource (pool or compute node) is using it. Before you can delete a certificate, you must therefore make sure that:

item.description: The certificate is not associated with any pools.
The certificate is not installed on any compute nodes. (Even if you remove a certificate from a pool, it is not removed from existing compute nodes in that pool until they restart.)

remarks.para: If you try to delete a certificate that is in use, the deletion fails. The certificate state changes to . You can use to set the status back to Active if you decide that you want to continue using the certificate.
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

remarks.para: The delete operation requests that the certificate be deleted. The request puts the certificate in the state. The Batch service will perform the actual certificate deletion without any further client action.
You cannot delete a certificate if a resource (pool or compute node) is using it. Before you can delete a certificate, you must therefore make sure that:

item.description: The certificate is not associated with any pools.
The certificate is not installed on any compute nodes. (Even if you remove a certificate from a pool, it is not removed from existing compute nodes in that pool until they restart.)

remarks.para: If you try to delete a certificate that is in use, the deletion fails. The certificate state changes to . You can use to set the status back to Active if you decide that you want to continue using the certificate.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IPagedEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Certificate> ListCertificates (Microsoft.Azure.Batch.DetailLevel detailLevel = null, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null);

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IPagedEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Certificate> ListCertificates(class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.DetailLevel detailLevel, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

Docs.param: A used for filtering the list and for controlling which properties are retrieved from the service.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the and .
Docs.summary: Enumerates the certificates in the Batch account.
Docs.returns: An that can be used to enumerate certificates asynchronously or synchronously.
Docs.remarks: This method returns immediately; the certificates are retrieved from the Batch service only when the collection is enumerated. Retrieval is non-atomic; certificates are retrieved in pages during enumeration of the collection.
